alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 4:58AM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of the Middle Keys from Layton Key to Duck Key Florida. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 457 AM EST, National Weather Service Meteorologist detected heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East End Of Long Key Viaduct, Long Key Viaduct, West End Of Long Key Viaduct, West End Of Channel 5 Bridge, Channel 5 Bridge, East End Of Channel 5 Bridge, Long Key, Conch Key, Craig Key and Duck Key. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
